title: Latest global political and military news
summary: Welcome to the Daily News Channel, everyone. I'm Joe. Meanwhile, the British Prime Minister visited China, India called for a ceasefire in Gaza at the UN, and several countries signed new agreements on defense and economic cooperation. I will now bring you a roundup of these important developments.
fullContent:
# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest global political and military news
**Time**: 2026/1/29 20:26

## Situation Overview
Welcome to the Daily News Channel, everyone. I'm Joe. The past 24 hours have seen dramatic shifts in the global political and security landscape: high-ranking US officials have made frequent statements on Venezuela, Iran, and trade with China; the Trump administration has escalated its military deterrence in the Middle East; major powers such as the UK, US, and Europe have continued to exert pressure on Ukraine, Russia, and energy sanctions; and in Asia, tensions have been palpable, from the US-South Korea free trade negotiations to maritime actions in the Taiwan Strait. Meanwhile, the British Prime Minister visited China, India called for a ceasefire in Gaza at the UN, and several countries signed new agreements on defense and economic cooperation. I will now bring you a roundup of these important developments.

## Key Intelligence
### US Secretary of State Marco Rubio hinted at possible additional military action against Venezuela in the Senate.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: The Guardian
- **Summary**: According to The Guardian, on January 28, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio testified before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, not ruling out the possibility of further military use in Venezuela. He noted that while there had been "significant progress" since Trump's "arrest" of Maduro on January 3, the situation remained highly uncertain. Facing sharp questioning from Democratic senators, Rubio acknowledged that the U.S. was still assessing its options for next steps.
- **References**:
  - [1] The Guardian: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-foreign-policy

### Trump warns Iran will face a large naval fleet.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Politico
- **Summary**: According to reports from Politico, CNN, and other media outlets, from January 28th to 29th, US President Trump publicly declared that unless Iran accepts a so-called "fair and reasonable" nuclear agreement, a large US fleet would be deployed to the Persian Gulf region. In a speech at the White House, he warned Iran that if it did not yield, it would face "worse" military strikes. The Iranian Foreign Ministry immediately stated that this move was provocative and that it was prepared for a swift retaliation.
- **References**:
  - [1] Politico: https://www.politico.com/news/2026/01/28/trump-iran-threats-massive-armada-00751756

### The US-Korea Free Trade Agreement will only take effect after being approved by the South Korean parliament.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: KBS World
- **Summary**: According to KBS World, on January 29, a U.S. Treasury official pointed out that the U.S.-South Korea Free Trade Agreement, which has already been reached, still needs formal approval from the South Korean National Assembly before it can take effect. The U.S. has expressed concerns about the agreement's compliance and labor rights provisions, demanding that South Korea provide corresponding legislative guarantees before tariff reductions and market access can be implemented.
- **References**:
  - [1] KBS World: http://world.kbs.co.kr/service/news_list.htm/news_view.htm?lang=e&Seq_Code=147503

### Trump's Middle East policy has been criticized for overreaching.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Foreign Policy
- **Summary**: A Foreign Policy analysis published on January 29 stated that the Trump administration's continued increase in military spending in the Middle East has shown signs of resource diversion and reduced diplomatic efforts. The article points out that frequent airstrikes, fleet deployments, and a hardline stance against Iran are casting doubt on the long-term strategic sustainability of the United States in the region.
- **References**:
  - [1] Foreign Policy: https://foreignpolicy.com/

### The United States continues to impose sanctions and tariffs on Russian oil companies.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Al Mayadeen
- **Summary**: Al Mayadeen reported on January 29 that US sanctions against major Russian oil companies remain in effect, and additional tariffs have been imposed on countries purchasing Russian crude oil. This move by the US government aims to further reduce Russia's energy revenue in order to maintain support for Ukraine.
- **References**:
  - [1] Al Mayadeen: https://english.almayadeen.net/news/politics/foreign-policy-setbacks-and-political-risks-define-trump-s-2

### The United States has firmly supported Israel in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: FDD
- **Summary**: A nighttime briefing released by the National Endowment for Defense and Democracy (FDD) on January 28 indicated that the United States continues to provide military assistance to Israel in the face of the Gaza war and assesses the potential impact of Trump's proposed postwar governance plan on regional security.
- **References**:
  - [1] FDD: https://www.fdd.org/overnight-brief/january-28-2026/

### British Prime Minister Starmer's first visit to China promotes warming of economic and trade relations.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Xinhua
- **Summary**: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer arrived in Beijing on January 29 for a three-day state visit, according to Xinhua News Agency. He met with Xi Jinping, Li Qiang, and Zhao Leji, focusing on trade, energy, and human rights issues. Both sides expressed their commitment to achieving deeper mutual benefit in economic and trade cooperation.
- **References**:
  - [1] Xinhua: https://english.news.cn/20260129/49e5cd1902244c5982f8e923ea83d974/c.html

### China calls on Iran to stop Mossad's activities in Iraq.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Modern Diplomacy
- **Summary**: Modern Diplomacy revealed on January 28 that Beijing is pressuring Tehran to stop the operations of the Israeli intelligence agency Mossad within Iran, claiming that this is part of intelligence cooperation between the two countries aimed at maintaining regional security.
- **References**:
  - [1] Modern Diplomacy: https://moderndiplomacy.eu/2026/01/28/how-china-aims-to-block-mossad-operations-in-iran/

### Taiwan Coast Guard issues warning for approximately 1,900 Chinese "Maritime Minuteman" vessels
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Taipei Times
- **Summary**: According to the Taipei Times, the Taiwan Coast Guard announced that approximately 1,900 vessels flying the Chinese flag participated in recent PLA exercises, including a 466-kilometer L-shaped formation intended to blockade shipping lanes and pose an unconventional operational threat.
- **References**:
  - [1] Taipei Times: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/front/archives/2026/01/29/2003851391

### China is investigating former Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission Zhang Youxia for suspected disciplinary violations.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Reuters
- **Summary**: Reuters reported on January 28 that China's Ministry of National Defense announced an investigation into Zhang Youxia, former vice chairman of the Central Military Commission, for serious violations of discipline. This large-scale purge of high-ranking military officials is considered one of the most important internal rectifications since the Cultural Revolution, raising concerns in the United States about the movements of the Chinese military.
- **References**:
  - [1] Reuters: https://www.reuters.com/world/china/fall-top-chinese-general-stirs-us-uncertainty-about-chinas-military-2026-01-28/

### Analysis of supply chain vulnerabilities between the US and China in a Pacific conflict
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: South China Morning Post
- **Summary**: A South China Morning Post article published on January 29 pointed out that if a conflict escalates in the Taiwan Strait, the logistical supply lines of both the US and Chinese militaries will face serious threats. The article, through simulated exercises, revealed the vulnerabilities of sea routes, ports, and key materials, reminding both sides to prepare defensive measures in advance.
- **References**:
  - [1] South China Morning Post: https://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3341565/would-chinese-or-us-supply-lines-be-more-vulnerable-pacific-conflict

### China's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Tan Sen, condemned the US threat against Iran at the Security Council.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Global Times
- **Summary**: According to a report by the Global Times on January 28, Fu Cong, China's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, addressed the Security Council, criticizing the United States for escalating its military threats against Iran and calling on all parties to exercise restraint and promote the resolution of tensions in the Middle East through diplomatic means.
- **References**:
  - [1] Global Times: https://www.globaltimes.cn/page/202601/1354411.shtml

### Taiwanese and US officials held talks on cooperation in AI, satellites, and submarine fiber optic cables.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Taipei Times
- **Summary**: According to a Taipei Times report on January 29, senior Taiwanese officials met with US representatives in Taipei to discuss technological cooperation in artificial intelligence, low-Earth orbit satellites, and submarine fiber optic cable protection, highlighting the deep collaboration between Taiwan and the US in the field of high-tech security.
- **References**:
  - [1] Taipei Times: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/front/archives/2026/01/29/2003851391

### The US security commitment to Ukraine is conditional upon the abandonment of Donbas.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: The Independent
- **Summary**: On January 28, The Independent reported that the U.S. government made it clear to Ukraine that any further security guarantees would be conditional on Ukraine agreeing to cede the Donbas region, a move seen as a signal of increased pressure from the U.S. in the negotiations.
- **References**:
  - [1] The Independent: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/ukraine-donbas-security-guarantees-2026-01-28

### Russian casualties in Ukraine are the heaviest since World War II.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: The Independent
- **Summary**: According to The Independent, the latest statistics show that Russia's battlefield casualties in Ukraine have reached approximately 1.2 million, making it the largest single conflict loss since World War II, highlighting the brutality and protracted nature of the war.
- **References**:
  - [1] The Independent: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/ukraine-russia-war-losses-2026-01-28

### Russian airstrikes on Ukraine's electricity and heating facilities have exacerbated the humanitarian crisis.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Al Arabiya
- **Summary**: Al Arabiya reported on January 29 that Russia has intensified its airstrikes on Ukraine's power and heating facilities, causing widespread power outages and heating disruptions. This comes at a time of severe cold, further exacerbating the plight of local civilians.
- **References**:
  - [1] Al Arabiya: https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2026/01/29/russian-strikes-pushing-ukraine-towards-humanitarian-catastrophe-eu-

### Russian defense industry orders growth slows as budgets tighten.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Japan Times
- **Summary**: According to a report by Japan Times on January 29, the Russian Ministry of Defense revealed that the growth rate of military orders in 2026 will be only 4% to 5%, far lower than the high growth rate of about 30% in the past three years. Budget cuts and rising war costs are the main factors.
- **References**:
  - [1] Japan Times: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/01/29/world/politics/kremlin-war-machine-budget/

### Russian military advance in Ukraine at the slowest pace in a century
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: The Telegraph
- **Summary**: The Telegraph analyzed on January 29 that since the outbreak of the Russia-Ukraine conflict, the Russian army's advance in Ukraine has slowed to its slowest pace in nearly a century of warfare, only a few times slower than the historical average.
- **References**:
  - [1] The Telegraph: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2026/01/29/russias-forces-move-slower-than-any-army/

### Israeli Ambassador to India Warns of Hamas Activities in Pakistan and Bangladesh
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: Deccan Herald reported on January 28 that Israeli Ambassador to India Raven Azhar warned that Hamas, active in Pakistan and Bangladesh, could pose a new threat to regional security, and called on neighboring countries to remain highly vigilant.
- **References**:
  - [1] Deccan Herald: https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml

### India calls for an immediate ceasefire in the Gaza conflict at the UN Security Council.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: On January 28, Deccan Herald quoted India's Permanent Representative to the United Nations as saying that India strongly condemned the Gaza war at the Security Council, demanding an immediate ceasefire and an expansion of humanitarian aid, and emphasizing the negative impact of the conflict on overall stability in the Middle East.
- **References**:
  - [1] Deccan Herald: https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml

### Taiwan and the United States reach new trade agreement to reduce tariffs
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Wikipedia – Current Events (AFP via France 24)
- **Summary**: According to Wikipedia's Current Events section (AFP/France24), Taipei and Washington signed a new trade agreement on January 28, reducing U.S. tariffs on Taiwanese goods from 20% to 15% in exchange for Taiwanese companies increasing their investment in the U.S.
- **References**:
  - [1] Wikipedia – Current Events: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### New Zealand suspends operations at its Tehran embassy and evacuates personnel.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Wikipedia – Current Events (AFP via Al Arabiya)
- **Summary**: According to Wikipedia's Current Events (AFP/Al Arabiya) report on January 28, New Zealand has decided to temporarily close its embassy in Tehran and relocate its diplomatic staff to Ankara due to the deteriorating situation in Iran and internet outages, while also urging its citizens to leave the country as soon as possible.
- **References**:
  - [1] Wikipedia – Current Events: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### France deploys additional troops in Greenland in response to Arctic security concerns
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Wikipedia – Current Events (France 24)
- **Summary**: France 24 News reported on January 28 that French President Macron announced the deployment of additional troops to Greenland following a Security Council meeting to address growing security challenges in the Arctic region.
- **References**:
  - [1] Wikipedia – Current Events: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### Japan and the Philippines sign defense logistics support agreement
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: Wikipedia – Current Events (Associated Press)
- **Summary**: According to the Associated Press (AP), Japan and the Philippines signed a defense agreement on January 28, under which the two sides will implement duty-free exchanges of ammunition, fuel, and food to strengthen logistical cooperation in the South China Sea.
- **References**:
  - [1] Wikipedia – Current Events: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### The US-Japan security alliance deepens cooperation and expands joint exercises in Tokyo.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: The Japan Times
- **Summary**: The Japan Times, citing a senior U.S. Department of Defense official, reported on January 29 that the U.S. and Japan held talks in Tokyo to discuss expanding joint military exercises and technology sharing, reaffirming the central role of the U.S.-Japan alliance in the Asia-Pacific region.
- **References**:
  - [1] The Japan Times: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/01/29/japan/politics/japan-us-defense-alliance-talks/

### Iran warns it will bomb Tel Aviv center if US military action is taken.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: The National News
- **Summary**: The National reported on January 29 that the Iranian Foreign Ministry warned that if the United States launches a military strike against Iran, Iran will launch a full-scale retaliatory bombing campaign against the heart of Israel's Tel Aviv region, stating that this would mark the beginning of a war.
- **References**:
  - [1] The National News: https://www.thenationalnews.com/news/mena/2026/01/29/iran-threatens-to-strike-heart-of-tel-aviv-in-response-to-us-attack/

### Trump warns Iran will face harsher retaliatory strikes.
- **Time**: 2026-01-28
- **Source**: CNN
- **Summary**: CNN, citing a White House statement on January 28, reported that Trump claimed the U.S. fleet was approaching Iran and warned that if Iran did not return to the nuclear negotiation track, it would suffer a “worse” military strike. Iranian officials called the remarks provocative and said they were prepared to carry out unprecedented retaliation.
- **References**:
  - [1] CNN: https://www.cnn.com/2026/01/28/politics/trump-threats-iran-nuclear-program-military-strike

### Türkiye arrests six suspects accused of spying for Iran.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Reuters
- **Summary**: Reuters reported on January 29 that Turkish security services arrested six suspects in Istanbul, including an Iranian citizen, on charges of political and military espionage for Iran, escalating tensions in the regional intelligence struggle.
- **References**:
  - [1] Reuters: https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/turkey-arrests-six-suspected-espionage-iran-state-broadcaster-says-2026-01-29/

### The United States proposes a Gaza arms buyback plan at the United Nations.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Japan Times
- **Summary**: On January 29, the Japan Times cited a statement from the United States at the UN Security Council, proposing an internationally funded arms buyback program for the Gaza Strip, aimed at reducing armaments through buybacks as a precondition for further Israeli troop withdrawal.
- **References**:
  - [1] Japan Times: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/01/29/world/politics/us-un-gaza-demilitarization-buyback/

### The United States is considering a limited, targeted strike against Iran to create domestic unrest.
- **Time**: 2026-01-29
- **Source**: Modern Diplomacy
- **Summary**: Modern Diplomacy reported on January 29 that internal sources indicate the Trump administration is assessing limited precision strikes against Iranian security forces and leaders in an effort to provoke domestic discontent and force Iran back to the nuclear negotiating table.
- **References**:
  - [1] Modern Diplomacy: https://www.moderndiplomacy.eu/2026/01/29/u-s-consideres-targeted-strikes-in-iran-to-boost-domestic-unrest/
